name: BUDAPEST GAMBIT
idea: The most aggressive response to 1.d4! After 2.c4 e5!? Black sacrifices a pawn for active piece play. After 3.dxe5 Ng4, the Knight attacks e5 and f2, creating immediate complications. White must be precise or get in trouble. It's a gambit that relies on activity and tactics rather than long-term compensation. Perfect for players who love surprises and complications!
errors_white: Taking on e5 then playing passively: Black gets excellent compensation
Advancing f3 to defend e5: weakens the King and opens the a7-g1 diagonal
Keeping the pawn at all costs: development is more important
errors_black: Not following up on the gambit: the Knight on g4 must be active
Exchanging pieces too early: Black needs pieces for the attack
Forgetting development: ...Nc6, ...Bc5, ...d6 and ...0-0 must come quickly
development: Goes to g4 to attack e5 and target f2 - the key journey!
Nc6 attacks e5 and develops quickly
Bc5 or Bb4+ depending on the line - active pieces!
Quick kingside castle after ...Be7 or stay flexible
...Qe7 in certain lines to recover e5
...d6 to support e5 or ...d5 to open the game

traps.name: Knight Trap
traps.desc: After 3...Ng4, if White plays 4.Bf4?? ...Nc6 5.Nf3 Bb4+! and after 6.Nbd2 Qe7 the e5 pawn falls with advantage. AVOID (White): Play 4.Nf3 or 4.e4 to defend e5 correctly.

traps.name: Fajarowicz Trap
traps.desc: 3...Ne4?! (Fajarowicz) is risky. After 4.Nf3! Black has no clear compensation. AVOID (Black): Prefer 3...Ng4 which is sounder.

traps.name: Queen Trap
traps.desc: After 4.Nf3 Nc6, if 5.Bf4?? ...Bb4+! 6.Nbd2 Qe7 7.a3 Ngxe5! Black wins material. AVOID (White): 5.e3 or 5.Nc3 are correct.

variants.name: Adler Variation
variants.uci: d2d4 g8f6 c2c4 e7e5 d4e5 f6g4 g1f3 b8c6 c1f4 f8b4 b1d2
variants.white_plan: Defend e5 and develop. After a3 and e3, White consolidates. The extra pawn is real but Black has play.
variants.black_plan: Pressure on e5! ...Qe7, ...Ngxe5 recovers the pawn. Then ...d6, ...0-0 with active position.

variants.name: Rubinstein Variation
variants.uci: d2d4 g8f6 c2c4 e7e5 d4e5 f6g4 c1f4 b8c6 g1f3 f8b4 b1c3 b4c3
variants.white_plan: After bxc3, White has the bishop pair. e3, Be2, 0-0 with solid structure.
variants.black_plan: Recover e5 with ...Qe7 and ...Ngxe5. White's structure with c3-c4 has holes on d4 and d3.

variants.name: Alekhine Variation
variants.uci: d2d4 g8f6 c2c4 e7e5 d4e5 f6g4 e2e4 g4e5 f2f4 e5c6 c1e3
variants.white_plan: Massive e4-f4 center. Develop Nc3, Nf3, Bd3 with lots of space.
variants.black_plan: White's center is imposing but Black has recovered the pawn. ...Bb4, ...d6, ...0-0 and look for ...f5.
